sentences.english: But after we fight we're the two most sorriest people you've ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 他倆幹完架後，絕對是你見過的這世上最爲歉疚的人。

sentences.english: In some cases, women return to abusive relationships because they feel sorry for their abusers.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，女人因歉疚而回歸受虐家庭。

sentences.english: There is no large-scale cultural opposition or guilt about making money.
sentences.chinese: 現在人們對於賺錢沒有大規模文化上的反感或歉疚感。

sentences.english: The students looked guilty and abashed.
sentences.chinese: 那些學生顯得歉疚而羞愧。

sentences.english: Yet bound by guilt or responsibility that they are pushed into marriage.
sentences.chinese: 然而或出於歉疚，或出於責任，他們被迫結婚。

sentences.english: In apology he explained why he was late.
sentences.chinese: 他歉疚地解釋自己遲到的原因。

sentences.english: For negligence care he emerald feeling grievously he give glory to persuade dance.
sentences.chinese: 玥爲疏忽照顧翠感歉疚，榮勸玥放棄跳舞。

definition: to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
